intro: Thlaspi rotundifolium subsp. grignense, commonly known as the Grignan bladderwort, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Native to southern Europe, this species thrives in moist, calcareous soils, often found in mountainous regions. The plant is notable for its unique morphology and is adapted to its specific ecological niche. It plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and distinctive features.
